department: Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department Of)
description: This project is about informing the Government of Canada on the design and implementation of a secure, global communications platform. The project involved working with the Government of Canada to identify security requirements, architecture, and technology to support a secure collaboration and communication platform for employees across all regions.
duration_in_months: Inspired by the nation-specific approach, the duration of the contract is two (2) years.
full_summary:
#### TBIPS Digital Transformation Support Services
#### Solicitation Number: 23-236665
#### Solicitation Date: March 1, 2023
#### Closing Date: March 16, 2023, 2:00 PM Eastern Daylight Saving Time (EDT)

Background:
The Canadian government is seeking to engage a contractor to provide Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) in support of the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development's Digital Transformation initiative. The contractor will be responsible for designing, architecting, and configuring a secure global communications platform.

Key Details:

* **Contract Title:** TBIPS Digital Transformation Support Services
* **Reference Number:** 23-236665
* **Solicitation Number:** 23-236665
* **Org:** Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
* **Classification (NAICS/GE):** 54151- Software Development and Implementation Services
* **Submission Deadline:** March 16, 2023
* **Contract Duration:** Two (2) years with one (1) one-year irrevocable option period
* **Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP)**: This NPP was published on March 2, 2023, with a closing date of March 16, 2023

Selection Criteria:

* Technological expertise in designing, architecting, and configuring a secure global communications platform
* Demonstrated experience in working with the department on similar projects
* Quality of the proposed solutions and services offered

Eligible Suppliers:
* TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region (NCR) for the following categories: Stream 4, Business Consultant, Business Architect, and Business Transformation Architect

Anticipated Start Date:
* April 1, 2023

Global Affairs Canada (GAC) is the End User Entity. The interests of this department will serve as the primary deliverables.

Evaluation and Selection Criteria:
The proposals will be assessed based on the bidder's competitive pricing, quality of services, and overall value to the department. The proposal must demonstrate that a minority has not reinvented the wheel. Technological expertise, as well as your extra resources and commitments, will be assessed.

Note: All solicitation documents are presented in English and French, and the Department reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

To submit an expression of interest for the TBIPS Digit Transformation Support Services, please contact [houssam.h
